HelpXML.Title: FSMfan
HelpXML.Purpose: FSMfan computes confirmatory lrt of a suggested transformation

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: la0
Item.LongDesc: Vector of length v=size(Y,2) specifying a reasonable set of transformations for the columns of the multivariate data set.

Item.Name: family
Item.ShortDesc: string which identifies the family of transformations which must be used.
Item.LongDesc: Possible values are 'BoxCox' (default) or 'YJ'. The Box-Cox family of power transformations equals $(y^{\lambda}-1)/\lambda$ for $\lambda \neq 0$, and $log(y)$ if $\lambda = 0$. The Yeo-Johnson (YJ) transformation is the Box-Cox transformation of y+1 for nonnegative values, and of |y|+1 with parameter $2-\lambda$ for y negative. The basic power transformation returns $y^{\lambda}$ if $\lambda \neq 0$ and $log(\lambda)$ otherwise. Remark. BoxCox and the basic power family can be used just if input y is positive. YeoJohnson family of transformations does not have this limitation.

Item.Name: init
Item.ShortDesc: Point where to start monitoring required diagnostics.
Item.LongDesc: Note that if bsb is supplied init>=length(bsb). If init is not specified it will be set equal to floor(n*0.6).

Item.Name: ColToComp
Item.ShortDesc: variables for which likelihood ratio tests have to be produced.
Item.LongDesc: It is a k x 1 integer vector. For example, if ColToComp = [2 4], the signed likelihood ratio tests are produced for the second and the fourth column of matrix Y. If col.to.compare = '' then all variables (columns of matrix Y) are considered.

Item.Name: laAround
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies for which values of lambda to compute the likelihood ratio test.
Item.LongDesc: It is a r x 1 vector. If this argument is omitted, the function produces for each variable specified in ColToComp the likelihood ratio tests associated to the five most common values of lambda [-1, -0.5, 0, 0.5, 1].

Item.Name: optmin
Item.ShortDesc: It contains the options dealing with the maximization algorithm.
Item.LongDesc: Use optimset to set these options. Notice that the maximization algorithm which is used is fminunc if the optimization toolbox is present else is fminsearch.

Item.Name: speed
Item.ShortDesc: It indicates the initial value of the maximization procedure.
Item.LongDesc: If speed=1 (default) the initial value at step m of the maximization procedure (fminunc or fminsearch) is the final value at step m-1 else it is la0.

Item.Name: colnames
Item.ShortDesc: the names of the variables of the dataset.
Item.LongDesc: Cell array of strings of length v containing the names of the variables of the dataset. If colnames is empty then the sequence 1:v is created to label the variables.

Item.Name: signlr
Item.ShortDesc: plots of signed square root likelihood ratios.
Item.LongDesc: If signlr = 1 (default) plots of signed square root likelihood ratios are produced, else likelihood ratios are produced.

Item.Name: plotslrt
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies whether it is necessary to plot the (signed square root) likelihood ratio test.

ItemCell.Description: minimum and maximum on the x axis;
minimum and maximum on the y axis;
Line width of the trajectory of lrt of transformation parameters;
vector which defines the confidence levels of the horizontal line for the likelihood ratio test (default is conflev=[0.95 0.99]);
Line width of the horizontal lines;
tag of the plot (default is pl_lrt). Example -'plotslrt',1 Data Types - double

Item.Name: msg
Item.ShortDesc: It controls whether to display or not messages about great interchange on the screen.
Item.LongDesc: If msg==1 (default) messages are displyed on the screen else no message is displayed on the screen.

ItemCell.Description: Cell of length ColtoComp. Each element of the cell contains the a (sub)cell of size length(laAround). Each element of the (sub)cell contains a n-init+1 x 11 which informs the order of entry of the units For example Unj=Un{i}{j} refers to ColtoComp(i) and laAround(j) Unj is a (n-init) x 11 matrix which contains the unit(s) included in the subset at each step of the fwd search. REMARK: in every step the new subset is compared with the old subset. Un contains the unit(s) present in the new subset but not in the old one Unj(1,2) for example contains the unit included in step init+1 Unj(end,2) contains the units included in the final step of the search

References.Item: Atkinson Riani and Cerioli (2004), Exploring multivariate data with the forward search Springer Verlag, New York.
